title: UK Gardens Face Flooding Crisis as Weather Patterns Shift
description: Defra warns British gardeners about increased flooding risks and provides guidance on flood-resistant plant selection and garden design strategies.

title: The Rise of Rare Houseplants: Inside The Hausplant's Unique Collection
description: New York Times explores the growing trend of rare and unique houseplants, profiling specialty retailers catering to plant collectors seeking unusual specimens.

title: Honolulu Plants Food in Public Spaces: Urban Agriculture Initiative
description: Hawaii's capital city launches groundbreaking program to transform public lands into edible gardens, providing fresh produce to local communities.

title: Best Long-Blooming Perennials for Sun in the Mid-Atlantic
description: Expert gardeners share top performing perennials for extended bloom times in Zone 6-7 gardens, perfect for Maryland and Virginia landscapes.

title: Pest Alert: Spotted Lanternfly Spreads Across Mid-Atlantic Region
description: Fine Gardening's regional expert warns about spotted lanternfly expansion in Maryland, Virginia, and Pennsylvania with identification and control strategies.

title: Hurricane Helene: Turning Disaster into Compost and Community
description: Garden clubs mobilize after Hurricane Helene, transforming storm debris into nutrient-rich compost while rebuilding devastated community gardens.

title: Farmers' Almanac 2026: What Gardeners Need to Know
description: The latest Farmers' Almanac predicts weather patterns for 2026 growing season, offering planting date recommendations for home gardeners.

title: Coffee Grounds Hack: Free Fertilizer for Your Garden
description: Gardening expert reveals how coffee grounds and filters can transform your vegetable garden's soil health and boost plant growth naturally.

title: Flower Expert: 5 Plants That Actually Thrive in Winter
description: Horticulture expert shares surprising winter-blooming plants that add color to gardens during the coldest months of the year.

title: Two New Gardens to Improve Drainage in Langley Park, Maryland
description: Prince George's County officials announce rain gardens that will reduce flooding while creating green space for the Langley Park community.
